title: E-Learning Quality Improvement Course Through Application of Software Engineering Design Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A course for practicing elementary educators to enhance e-learning design capabilities in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, including training in applying software engineering principles to complex educational content development.

learning_goals: Learners can optimize content structures by applying software engineering design principles (abstraction, modularization, etc.) to e-learning design
Learners can design reusable e-learning modules in PBL environments and apply them to real-world projects
Learners can plan and evaluate scalable e-learning solutions even in constrained technological environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
